meanings.definition: The quality or state of lacking a defined form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting captured the shapelessnesses of the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The shapelessnesses of the dough made it difficult to mold into a specific form.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt at drawing resulted in a masterpiece of shapelessnesses.
meanings.sent4: The fog enveloped the city in a cloak of shapelessnesses, hiding all landmarks from view.
meanings.sent5: The shapelessnesses of the jello jiggled on the plate, mesmerizing the children.

meanings.definition: The condition of being without a distinct shape or outline.
meanings.sent1: The shapelessnesses of the shadow made it hard to identify the object casting it.
meanings.sent2: The shapelessnesses of the mist obscured the view of the mountains in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved transforming a hat full of shapelessnesses into a rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The shapelessnesses of the ghostly figure sent shivers down the spine of the witness.
meanings.sent5: The shapelessnesses of the jellyfish allowed it to gracefully float through the water.
